description.p: Bards of the College of the Dirgesingers play tunes of melancholy and death in contrast to the pleasant music of most bards. Dirgesingers embrace death into their music and channel powers of the grave into their works. Dirgesingers sing the tales of Fallen Heroes, and of tragedies. A dirgesinger embraces the dark side of things.

Beginning at 3rd level you learn how to channel the powers of death into your songs. As an action, you may expend a use of your bardic inspiration and choose a target. The chosen individual then deals additional necrotic damage to their weapon attack equal to your bardic inspiration die. The effect lasts for one minute.

sheet.description: You may expend a use of your bardic inspiration and choose a target. The chosen individual then deals additional necrotic damage to their weapon attack equal to your bardic inspiration die. The effect lasts for one minute.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, your songs call forth the dead. You learn the animate dead spell as a bard spell if you have not already and the spell does not count against the bard spells you know. Whenever you cast animate dead as a bard spell you may create one additional undead. All undead you create with the animate dead spell add {{necromancer:bonus}} to all their weapon attack rolls and gain a bonus to their melee weapon damage and spell attacks equal to your charisma modifier.

sheet.description: Whenever you cast animate dead as a bard spell you may create one additional undead. All undead you create with the animate dead spell uses your charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus for all their weapon attack rolls and gain a +{{charisma:bonus}} bonus to their melee weapon damage and spell attacks.

description.p: When you reach 14th level, you learn the danse macabre spell. It counts as a bard spell for you, and doesnâ€™t count against the number of spells known. Additionally as a bonus action, you can expend 1 Bardic Inspiration die, giving hit points to all the undead that you raised, be it by spell or another effect, equal to the number rolled in the dice.
